channel.title: Laptop for uni
channel.description:
Well my girlfriend wants a laptop for uni, her parents said for her birthday they'll get her one. She's asking me to find her a good one but I know nothing about whats good and bad with laptops.
Anyone know a good laptop for between 300-500£ ?
Needs to have windows 7.

item.title: Laptop for uni
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

uk.dynamism.com

Dynamism - 3D Printing Solutions including hardware, software, and training....

Dynamism is the leader in 3D printing advisory, hardware, software, and training. Talk to us about your 3D printing goals, and rely on us for best-of-class 3D printing solutions and support.

item.title: Laptop for uni
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:18, topic:340160”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=436534.msg3207573#msg3207573 date=1273944449]
so susies parents trust you now?
[/quote]
I will answer when you fix analheim

Don’t get the dells listed above they got shit for graphics.

http://www.asuslaptop.co.uk/proddetail.php?prod=K50ID-SX114V

I think this is actually a very suitable one, will show it to my girlfriend. I don’t think she’s that bothered on the colour, I’d have thought she’d want a pink one…
edit - although when vat is put on it it goes to £550 so I’ll have to take that in to account

edit2 - turns out she found this:
http://www1.euro.dell.com/uk/en/home/Laptops/studio-1747/pd.aspx?refid=studio-1747&s=dhs&cs=ukdhs1&~ck=mn
she’s going with the £599 one… totally between her price range. But it means she gets to add some stupid design to the case :P[/quote]

Well at least it has ATI Mobility RadeonTM HD 560v

which still probably isnt that great but better than intel integrated (i think)

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop for uni
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:19, topic:340160”]I would of suggested this:

http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/dell-inspiron-1564-04127313-pdt.html

Picked it out for someone i know, he got it and it looks nice and has some nice stuff. It also has an i3, which is a great CPU for the price range and gives a significant improvement over similar CPUs.[/quote]
would have*

item.title: Laptop for uni
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Have you looked at the Acer Aspire series?

This is from the 5532, but I’m sure the others in the series could be better. (IIRC, this has a 1.6Ghz single core processor)

[code]Operating System

  • Genuine Windows® 7 Home Premium
    Processor & Chipset
  • AMD Better By Design program, featuring:
  • AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 dual-core processor with 1 MB L2 cache or
  • AMD Athlon™ 64 processor with 512KB L2 cache
  • AMD M780G Chipset
    Memory
  • Dual-channel DDR2 SDRAM support
  • Up to 2 GB of DDR2 667 MHz memory, upgradeable to 4 GB using two soDIMM modules (only for 64bit * OS)
    HDD
  • 160/250/320/500 GB or larger hard disk drive (depending on the model)
    Storage
  • 8X DVD-Super Multi double-layer drive
  • Multi-in-1 card reader, supporting Secure Digital™ (SD), MultiMediaCard (MMC), Memory Stick™ (MS), * Memory Stick PRO™ (MS PRO), xD-Picture Card™ (xD)
    Display
  • 15.6" HD 1366 x 768 pixel resolution, high-brightness (220-nit)
  • 16.7 million colours
  • 16:9 aspect ratio
    Graphics
  • ATI Radeon™ HD 3200 Graphics with up to 19198 MB of HyperMemory™ (256 MB of dedicated system * memory, up to 1663 MB of shared system memory), supporting Unified Video Decoder (UVD), OpenEXR * High Dynamic-Range (HDR) technology, Shader Model 4.0, Microsoft® DirectX® 10
  • Dual independent display support
  • MPEG-2/DVD decoding
  • WMV9 (VC-1) and H.264 (AVC) decoding
  • Acer Arcade™ Deluxe featuring Acer CinemaVision™ and Acer ClearVision™ technologies
    Multimedia
  • High-definition audio support
  • MS-Sound compatible
  • Two built-in stereo speakers
  • Communication
  • Acer Integrated Acer Crystal Eye webcam, supporting enhanced Acer PrimaLite™ technology
  • WLAN: Acer InviLink™ Nplify™ 802.11b/g/Draft-N Wi-Fi CERTIFIED™ network connection, supporting * Acer SignalUp™ wireless technology or
  • WLAN: Acer InviLink™ 802.11b/g Wi-Fi CERTIFIED® network connection, supporting Acer SignalUp™ * wireless technology
  • LAN: 10/100 Mbps Fast Ethernet, Wake-on-LAN ready
    I/O Interface
  • 2x USB 2.0 ports
  • 1x external display (VGA) port
  • 1x Headphones/speaker/line-out jack with S/PDIF support
  • 1x Microphone-in jack
  • 1x Ethernet (RJ-45) port
  • 1x DC-in jack for AC adapter
    Security
  • Slot for Kensington lock
  • BIOS user, supervisor, HDD passwords
    Power Supply & Battery
  • Product Safety Electric Appliance and Materials (PSE) certified for battery pack
  • 48.84 W 4400 mAh 6-cell Li-ion battery pack:
  • up tp 2.5-hour battery life
  • 2.5-hour rapid charge system-off
  • 3.5-hour charge-in-use
  • 65 W AC adapter
  • Energy Star®
    Keyboard & Special Controls
  • 99-/100-/103-key full-size keyboard with inverted “T” cursor layout
  • Touchpad pointing device
  • 10 function keys, four cursor keys, two Windows® keys, independent numeric keypad, international * language support
  • Easy-launch keys: touchpad lock, WLAN
  • Media control keys (printed on keyboard): play/pause, stop, previous, next
    Weight & Dimensions
  • 372.3 (W) x 246.5 (D) x 26.8/39.6 (H) mm (14.4 x 10.8 x 1.1/1.5 inches)
  • 2.7 kg (6.0 lbs.) with 6-cell battery pack
  • Quality & Reliability Tests
  • Temperature & humidity test
  • Free drop test
  • Acoustics test
  • Weight and Pressure tests
  • Spillage test
  • Shock and Vibration tests
  • Electrostatic discharge immunity test
  • MTBF (Mean Time Between Failure) test
  • Hinge life test
  • Keyboard-switch life test
    [/code]

http://www.acer.co.uk/acer/productv.do?LanguageISOCtxParam=en&kcond61e.c2att101=71155&sp=page16e&ctx2.c2att1=17&link=ln438e&CountryISOCtxParam=UK&ctx1g.c2att92=122&ctx1.att21k=1&CRC=1621985307

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop for uni
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Get her an iPad /Sarcasm

From my experience, stay away from hp and toshiba.

XPS, Acer and Viao are good. Acer is probably your best option when it comes to pricing, she’ll love it because Acer laptops have the best laptop screens I’ve ever seen.

Read full topic

Intel® Celeron® Processor 900 (2.20 GHz, 1MB L2 Cache, 800MHz FSB)

2048MB 800MHz Dual Channel DDR2 SDRAM [2x1024]
500GB (5400RPM) Serial ATA Hard Drive

4-cell 24WHr Li-Ion primary battery

item.title: Laptop for uni
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

newegg.com

ASUS Laptop K50ID-X1 Intel Pentium dual-core T4400 (2.20 GHz) 4 GB...

Buy ASUS Laptop K50ID-X1 Intel Pentium dual-core T4400 (2.20 GHz) 4 GB Memory 320 GB HDD NVIDIA GeForce GT 320M 15.6" Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Its in your price range also. It has a really good video card being a laptop so it should be ok if you plans to do any enginneering stuff or visual arts stuff.

I know your not in America but you should be able to find it in the UK around the same price.
